Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; ENGRAVED; FAYENCE; ENGRAVED
Name: Shabti of Horoudja
Description: This shabti in green-brown faience is part of  the oldest collection of the Museum. It was offered by M. Bove in 1844. The hieroglyphic text written on nine horizontal lines and containing Chapter 6 from the Book of the Dead is difficult to read. The piece belonged to the "priest-wnr" Horoudja, who lived during the Late Period.
